channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped in my parking space, 12th August
item.description:
Ongoing issue. We often have drug users hanging around and there is a lot of rubbish dumped at pinned location (at the rear of 22 mare street). These are both private parking spaces. Many thanks for anything that can be done to clear this rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The light outside is ridiculously bright, 12th August
item.description:
The street light outside 14 gundulph road is super bright and way brighter than all the others. It shines through my window all night even with blinds. Please can you look into getting a lower powered light, this one is ridiculous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gundulph Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Graffiti on wall and metal beam, 12th August
item.description:
On the Harrow Manorway bridge just before the stairs, there's a concrete wall with graffiti on the northern face as well as the western face. Attached to the northern part of the wall is a blue steel truss/beam also with markings. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harrow Manorway, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree struck by bus and left in footpath, 12th August
item.description:
Last week the tree by the bus stop was struck by a local bus. The fire brigade attended to the tree and cut it back at the time of the event. However they left a sizable branch overhanging the verge and protruding in the footpath which has still not been removed. They also left a lot of redundant tree vegetation in the verge area. This needs to be attended to by the council to o avoid someone tripping over or a child striking their leg on the bit obstructing the path. The cut back tree vegetation should also be collected to avoid attraction of vermin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nuxley Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bings outside residential area, 12th August
item.description:
For about a week now there’s been full bins, not collected cleaning crews. Don’t know exactly why. Suspect initially some bins weren’t sorted properly. Now it’s escalated to the situation seen in the attached pictures.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Colomb Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Physical vibration of property from good vehicles, buses and large cars, 12th August
item.description:
I live next to the road and we experience vibration resonance in the building occuring whenever larger vehicles drive past the building. My first concern is that the vehicles are not obeying the speed limit as this would increase the risk of vibration. Second is that there may be unintentional structural problems with the road that are affecting property's adjacent to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 165, Brecknock Road, Archway, London
Report on FixMyStreet
